golden_comment: Mixing float: left with flexbox causes layout issues. Further this PR removes the float-based right alignment for .d-header .panel, which may cause the login panel in the non-Ember/noscript header (where .panel is nested inside .row and not a flex item) to stack under the title instead of remaining right-aligned.

audit.code_evidence: The PR removes 'float: right' from .d-header .panel (line 35 in original, now lines 35-40). In app/views/application/_header.html.erb, the noscript header has .panel nested inside .row (not directly in .contents), so flexbox styling on .contents won't position it. The panel relied on float: right for positioning.
audit.reasoning: Real bug confirmed. The noscript header at app/views/application/_header.html.erb shows .panel inside .row inside .contents. Since flexbox is applied to .contents but .panel is not a direct child (it's inside .row), the margin-left: auto and order(3) won't affect it. Without float: right, the panel will not be right-aligned.

golden_comment: -ms-align-items never existed in any version of IE/Edge; the correct legacy property is -ms-flex-align.

missing_details: Line number (though property name is specific)
audit.code_evidence: Line 122 in mixins.scss shows -ms-align-items: $alignment which is an invalid property. IE10 uses 2012 flexbox syntax with -ms-flex-align, not -ms-align-items.
audit.reasoning: Real bug confirmed. Both droid and golden correctly identify that -ms-align-items is not a valid CSS property. The correct IE10/11 property is -ms-flex-align (which is already present at line 121).
